intro: Angraecum sesquisectangulum, commonly known as the Madagascar star orchid, is a striking epiphytic orchid native to the island of Madagascar. It features elongated, narrow leaves and produces fragrant, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue with dark purple markings. The plant is notable for its nocturnal blooming habit, with flowers opening at night to attract specific pollinators like moths. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil and consistent moisture. Due to its rarity and unique characteristics, it is a prized species among orchid enthusiasts.
